page.title: 02Landowners, Kildonan Strath
page.content: In 1864 Queen Victoria built Balmoral Castle. Rich people followed her example and bought estates in Scotland. The Strath of Kildonan is divided into six estates -Achentoul, Badanloch, Borrobol,Suisgill, Kildonan and Torrish. Some of them are owned by well known personalities. The land in our block is owned by the Rt. Hon.Sir Anthony Nutting who was Under Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs 1951-54 and by Viscount Leverhulme who has a large estate in Cheshire. Barbara Cartland, the famous novelist, is also part owner of an estate. Most of the propietors have land in England but come to Scotland to fish and shoot.
